LIVER.other: remaining hepatic parenchyma appears within normal limits, contour of the liver is smooth

GALLBLADDER.stones: no evidence of stones or gallbladder wall thickening

cystic_duct_stone.description: likely within the cystic duct, previously seen in body of the gallbladder

PANCREAS.status: within normal limits, without masses or pancreatic ductal dilation

findings.VASCULATURE: Visualized portions of aorta and IVC are within normal limits

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The mass in the liver has increased in size from 1.7 x 1.7 cm to 2.2 x 2.0 cm. The cystic duct stone was previously seen in the body of the gallbladder and is now noted in the cystic duct.

laboratory_examinations.findings: MIXED BACTERIAL FLORA (>= 3 colony types), consistent with skin and/or genital contamination.
